title: China hawks sharpen their talons at House committee hearing on CCP
description: A bipartisan show of concern over the pernicious influence of the Chinese Communist Party elicited condemnation in Beijing.

title: What to know about ‘Havana syndrome’
description: As many as 200 incidences of the mysterious affliction have been reported among U.S. personnel in Russia, China, Colombia, Uzbekistan and elsewhere.

title: Activist appears targeted at Mexican president's press brief
description: A human rights activist in Mexico’s dangerous northern border city of Nuevo Laredo says he suspects the Mexican army — and the government in general — are behind claims linking him to a drug cartel

title: A girl drew an antiwar picture in school. Russia detained her dad.
description: A single father faces three years in jail, and his daughter may be sent to an orphanage, after a teacher called police about a drawing that said "No to war."

title: Harry, Meghan asked to leave UK home in further royal rift
description: Prince Harry and his wife, Meghan, have been asked to vacate their home in Britain

title: Prince Harry and Meghan asked to ‘vacate’ Frogmore Cottage
description: The Sun tabloid, citing unnamed sources, said the five-bedroom property had been offered to Prince Andrew.

title: Ice Age Europeans found refuge in Spain, doom in Italy
description: New research reveals that the hunter-gatherer people who dominated Europe 30,000 years ago sought refuge from the last Ice Age in warmer climes, but only those who sheltered in the southwest of the continent appear to have survived

title: UN chief praises moves toward stability in rare Iraq visit
description: The U.N. chief has praised Iraq for repatriating its citizens detained in neighboring Syria on suspicion of ties to the Islamic State group during a rare visit to Baghdad

title: UK: Remains of baby found after missing couple arrested
description: British police have found the remains of a 2-month old baby in woodland after officers arrested the infant’s mother and her boyfriend

title: Mexican president lashes out at Supreme Court chief justice
description: Mexico’s president has lashed out at the chief justice of the country’s Supreme Court, accusing her of promoting rulings that favor criminal suspects

title: Suspected poisonings at Iranian girls’ schools leave dozens hospitalized
description: The suspected poisonings appear to be largely affecting girls' schools across Iranian cities.

title: UN scrambles to reunite families after Turkey-Syria quake
description: The head of the U.N. children’s agency says that reuniting children with their missing family is a top priority after last month’s massive earthquake that struck Turkey and Syria

title: Turkey earthquakes generated 10 times more rubble than 2010 Haiti disaster
description: Estimates of rubble following the earthquakes in Turkey and Syria from the U.N. Development Program were higher than other recent disasters.

title: US Army artillery officer dies during assignment in Thailand
description: A U.S. Army officer has died while in temporary duty in Thailand to take part in a major multinational military exercise

title: Israeli police violently crack down on protest over judicial overhaul
description: Israeli police lobbed hundreds of stun grenades, fired water cannons and arrested at least 40 people in response to Wednesday’s demonstration against a judicial overhaul in Tel Aviv.

title: Finland begins building 10-foot-high razor-wire wall along Russian border
description: Five E.U. nations plan to build more than 770 miles of fencing along their borders with Russia and Belarus. One expert called it a "barbed-wire curtain."

title: Medical helicopter with 5 aboard missing in Philippines
description: A helicopter carrying five people, including a hospital patient and a nurse, has gone missing in a western Philippine province and an air and sea search has been launched

title: Rights lawyers seek ICC probe into Turkey allegations
description: Human rights lawyers have called on the International Criminal Court to open an investigation into alleged crimes they say were committed by Turkish authorities against thousands of opponents of President Recep Tayyip Erdogan

title: Birth of Mexican volcano inspires scientists 80 years later
description: The ground is still hot atop the crater of Paricutin _ the first volcano of its kind to have its full life cycle documented by modern science when it erupted 80 years ago

title: Top Lebanese intel chief, mediator with Syria steps down
description: A Lebanese intelligence chief who has mediated the release of Westerners held in Syria and also acted as a mediator within Lebanon has stepped down after attempts to extend his term failed

title: Iran's president orders probe of poisoning at girls' schools
description: Iran’s president has ordered authorities to investigate a series of incidents in which noxious fumes have sickened students at girls’ schools, which some officials suspect are attacks targeting women’s education

title: A ‘monster wildfire’ ravaged France last summer. It’s still burning.
description: A “zombie fire” is smoldering underground. Drought has made other winter fires unusually intense. The concept of a "wildfire season" could be fading.

title: Ukrainians welcome spring, say they survived Putin’s ‘winter terror’
description: Ukrainians marked the first day of spring with words of hope and pictures of flowers on social media, acknowledging they had survived a bleak winter at war with Russia.

title: Moldova's new PM visits neighboring Romania to boost ties
description: Romanian Prime Minister Nicolae Ciuca has held talks with his Moldovan counterpart as the two neighbors seek to boost ties amid Russia’s war in Ukraine

title: UN slams deployment f South Sudan troops in disputed region
description: The United Nations has condemned the deployment of South Sudanese troops in an area of the disputed region of Abyei, which both Sudan and South Sudan claim

title: When Ukraine goes dark
description: One Kyiv apartment building coping with power outages shows the widespread toll of Ukraine’s war away from the front line.

title: Cambodia says recent bird flu cases not spread by humans
description: Health officials in Cambodia say recent cases of bird flu discovered in two villagers, one of them fatal, show no sign of human-to-human transmission

title: Israeli army arrests Palestinian suspects in deadly shooting
description: The Israeli military says Israeli troops arrested two Palestinians suspected of involvement in the killing earlier this week of an American-Israeli

title: Pakistan aims for tighter security in 1st digital census
description: Officials say Pakistan has launched its first-ever digital population and housing census to gather demographic data ahead of parliamentary elections this year

title: 2 dead as migrant boat capsizes off eastern Greek island
description: Greek authorities say at least two people have drowned after an overloaded boat carrying nearly 30 migrants sank off Greece’s eastern Aegean Sea island of Kos

title: At least 22 people, including children, abducted in Congo
description: Authorities in Congo say at least 22 people, including children, have been abducted from three villages in the north

title: Shipwreck off Italy: stadium filled with coffins of migrants
description: The coffins of dozens of migrants who died in a shipwreck off Italy’s southern coast have been laid out in rows inside a sports complex for public viewing

title: Murakami's 1st novel in 6 years to hit stores in April
description: A new Haruki Murakami novel will be published in April and the publisher is saying little about it except that the Japanese manuscript is around 1,200 pages and the plot involves “a story that had long been sealed.”

title: Ukraine official says military may pull back from Bakhmut
description: Ukraine’s military could pull back from the key eastern stronghold of Bakhmut amid a relentless Russian offensive to capture the city

title: Iran expels 2 German envoys amid uproar over death sentence
description: Iran says it has expelled two German diplomats over Berlin’s alleged interference in its internal affairs

title: Ex-UK health chief defends record after COVID messages leak
description: Britain’s former health minister is denying wrongdoing after a newspaper published extracts of private messages he sent in the first weeks of the coronavirus pandemic

title: FlyDubai announces record profit as Gulf air travel booms
description: Budget carrier FlyDubai has announced record profits amid a surge in air travel following the lifting of pandemic restrictions

title: Ancient restaurant highlights Iraq's archeology renaissance
description: An international archeological mission has found the remnants of a 5,000-year-old restaurant in the ancient city of Lagash in southern Iraq

title: US increases military support for Somalia against al-Shabab
description: The United States is increasing its military assistance to Somalia as the country sees success in battling what the U_S_ calls “the largest and most deadly al-Qaida network in the world.”

title: In Egypt, government and poor struggle with troubled economy
description: Egypt is in an economic crisis worsened by the Russian invasion of Ukraine

title: Why Greta Thunberg is protesting wind farms in Norway
description: The climate activist is supporting Sami Indigenous rights activists who want Norway to shut down a major wind project built on land used by their reindeer.

title: Israelis step up protests over government's legal overhaul
description: Israelis are stepping up their protests against a contentious government plan to overhaul the judicial system

title: Head-on train crash in Greece kills 32, injures at least 85
description: A passenger train carrying hundreds of people, including many university students returning home from holiday, collided at high speed with an oncoming freight train

title: Ukraine live briefing: Battle for Bakhmut intensifies; G-20 foreign ministers to meet
description: Russia has deployed mercenaries from the Kremlin-linked Wagner Group to break through Bakhmut's defenses, according to Ukrainian officials.

title: Chilean circus has fought LGBTQ discrimination for 54 years
description: The transformation begins as night falls on this semi-desert esplanade on the outskirts of Chile’s capital, with Arturo, Alejandro and René applying makeup and donning wigs, feathers and sequins to become “Verónica Power,” Älexandra” and “The Crazy Purse Woman.”

title: The West shrugs as a democracy dies
description: After years of fitfully working toward consolidating its fledgling democracy, Tunisia enters a dark phase of authoritarian consolidation.
